A picturesque adventure through England's most wooded county with a variety of attractions from historic buildings, picture postcard rural rivers and even a Witches cave. A glorious circular hike from the ancient market town of Farnham steeped in history going back nearly 1000 years on this trail through time. One of the very first Outdooraholics hikes from all those years ago, but still a timeless classic.

Trip Highlights:

\u2022 Explore the romantic and enchanting ruins of an abandoned abbey dating back nearly 1000 years

\u2022 Visit the famous and picture postcard Tilford village cricket green

\u2022 See an 800 year old oak tree

\u2022 Visit a cave where supposedly a White Witch lived (Mother Ludlam)

\u2022 Explore the Bourne Woods and see where Gladiator and over 20 other films were set

\u2022 Idyllic hiking along the banks of the River Wey through woodland paths

Photos - All photos were taken by Outdooraholics on previous trips

Join our Facebook community:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/Outdooraholics

Hike Description

Starting in the historic and attractive Georgian market town of Farnham, we go on a woodland valley trail via Mother Ludlam's cave (home to the White Witch of Waverley according to the legend), past Moor Park House, and then on to explore the site of Waverley Abbey ruins (founded 1128) and to see the grand Waverley Abbey House set on a lake. Our trail passes the famous cricket green at Tilford set in the delightful landscape of the River Wey and flanked by two medieval stone bridges and then onto the Bourne Woods.

Tilford Green is a superb example of a traditional village green from a long gone era - with a cricket pitch, pub and two medieval stone bridges. We then head on to visit an 800 year old oak tree (8 metre girth) before making our way back to Farnham. We also pass a farm where we see pigs (and often baby piglets). The Bourne woods has an interesting mix of heathland and coniferous trees and its beauty has drawn filmmakers for films such as Gladiator, Robin Hood, Harry Potter and the Half Blood Princess, War Horse and at least 20 others - we'll be hiking through the area where these were filmed.

Transport & Meeting Point

We'll meet at Waterloo station at 8:30am and leave the meeting point at 8:45am for the 9:07am train. Please make sure to arrive on time as the group cannot wait for anyone who is late.

We'll meet under the main clock (in front of the departures board). Please click here for a photo of the clock: http://goo.gl/sqsFwr
Please click here for a map of where the clock is: http://goo.gl/piwT4R

Planned arrival time back into London of 6:40pm (we have a group train ticket and you are committed for the day until then)

Food

We'll stop during the hike for a snack lunch so please bring food and drink. We\u2019ll visit a pub after the hike where we can get refreshments.

Distance, Difficulty and Terrain

Distance: 12 miles (19km)
Grading: Intermediate - click here for details:
https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/Hike_Gradings
Ascent: 270m
Hiking time: About 4.5 to 5 hours of actual hiking
Terrain: Mainly flat, one hill at the end. A mix of mainly gravel and sand tracks

Cost and Payment

The trip is £28 per person which includes the guided hike and return train travel from the group departure station listed at the top of this event. To join us please RSVP Yes and you will be automatically redirected to PayPal.

Payments are non-refundable and non-transferable but we have a process to release your space for resale to another member. Please follow the instructions in our FAQ page (https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/6368852/FAQ) and email us with your PayPal \u201cinvoice ID\u201d immediately after you change your RSVP to \u201cNO\u201d. If you do not email us at the time of changing your RSVP OR if your space does not sell, you will not be eligible for a refund.

What to Bring

\u2022 Suitable hiking clothes & hiking footwear (ideally hiking boots). Waterproof jacket, trousers and footwear are recommended

\u2022 Water (at least 1 and ideally 2 litres)

\u2022 Packed lunch/picnic

\u2022 Money for drinks and refreshments after the hike

\u2022 Due to the early sunsets this hike could finish around sunset, so bringing a torch if you have one is advisable or a charged mobile phone with flashlight just in case

\u2022 That's it! We will take care of train tickets, logistics on the day etc, so that you can just turn up and have a great day :-)

Safety

This hike is led by a trained hike leader - most of our guides are Mountain Leader trained (https://www.mountain-training.org/walking/skills-and-awards/mountain-leader) and qualified Outdoor Activity First Aider. Outdoor activities involve a risk of personal injury. Please come with hiking footwear and suitable hiking clothes such as warm clothes, waterproof jacket and trousers in case of rain - for more info please click here: https://www.londonhiking.co.uk/Equipment.pdf

Terms and Conditions

By signing up to or attending this event you agree to the Terms and Conditions below:
https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/3458542/TermsConditions

Follow us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/outdooraholics

Sign up to our monthly newsletter:
http://forms.aweber.com/form/47/821286447.htm

© Outdooraholics Ltd 2020
Errors and Omissions Excepted

Come along on Wednesday 19th February at 6:30pm for a Midweek Coffee Evening!

These will be regular social events on Wednesday evenings at coffee shops all over London. That way people can join us after work or if they live nearby.

It's a chance to chat and get to know people in the group in a quiet relaxed setting over a coffee. We can also talk about things people want to see in London with the group. These evenings are also good for 1st timers to attend to find out more about the group.

We will have Cultureseekers signs up inside the cafe where we are sitting, so keep a lookout.

We tend to stay in the coffee shop until about 8:30pm.

Hope to see you there!

Robert

Join us for yet another fantastic walking tour - this time in classic MAYFAIR with Barrie and get to see a different side of society....

MAYFAIR\u2026.Not as gentile as it seems.
====================================================
Riots........ Casinos ..........Scandals .......and much more

Mayfair isn't what it might seem on the surface - there's an underbelly of scandal and debauchery that may surprise you. Lots of stories of casinos
and riches won and lost

Our walk takes us from the grandeur of one of London\u2019s finest hotels and on past the homes of Lords and Ladies whose stories fed the Sunday tabloids for many years.

There's the site of the legendary 1968 march protesting the Vietnam war. Just a stone's throw away, is the contrast of London\u2019s up-market casino area and its high-class red light district.

We then pass the apartment where incredibly not one but two legends of the 60\u2019s music scene took their last breaths. We finish at the site of a notorious, legendary nightclub where it wasn't just carrots on the menu!

Our walk which lasts around two hours and a half and will be illustrated by historical photographs and music. It starts at Claridges and ends in Park Lane Cost : £10 in cash on the day

This is an Angular Bootcamp.

The course will last 4 weeks, every Monday from 24th of February till 23rd of March (the first week of March will be skipped).

Teachers & Mentors: Eddie Jaoude, Andrew Cunliffe.

* Talk 1: Services
* Talk 2: External data with http requests
* Workshop: Make a 3rd party API request for data

---

It is free to attend. Please bring your own laptop.

---

Pizzas, snacks, sodas, juices and water will be provided.

---

18:00 - 18:30 Meet, Greet and Pizza Time
18:30 - 19:30 First part of the lecture
19:40 - 20:15 Second part of the lecture
20:15 - 21:00 Hands-on and questions
21:00 - 22:00 Party!

Another amazing venue for an early dinner with this elegant and well appoited restaturant nestled in the 5 star Hotel Cafe Royal, a place full of history where since 1890 great minds such as Winston Churchill, Oscar Wilde, Virginia Wolf, George Bernard Shaw, just to mention few, used to meet to discuss they projects. It was a place to see and be seen at.

Now, it's our time to be seen at the Laurent, grill and sushi bar by the internationally renowed chef Laurent Tourondel.

We will go for the 3 courses set menu + a glass of champagne as you can see at the sample bellow:

Starter
-Kale & Wheat Berry with Confit Duck Leg, heritage quinoa, grapefruit, champagne vinaigrette
-Tuna, Yellowtail & Salmon -Roll, ginger, wasabi, tobiko
-Curried Lentil Soup, coconut, carrot and crispy poppadum (v)

Main Course
-Braised Lamb Shank, glazed turnips, crispy cilantro rice
-Grilled Salmon, crushed new potato, sautéed rainbow chard, citrus sage and basil oil
-Cauli lower Risotto, cauliflower florets, cauliflower purée and lemon balm (v)

Dessert
- Organic Pear & Almond Tart, cashew cream (v)
- Tunworth Cheese, caramelized walnut and quince
- Tart Choco Gianduja-Caramel, light mascarpone cream

I booked 2 tables of 6 guests for 6:00 pm. Please bear in mind that it might be a gap of 15 minutes to be seated.

The cost of this event is £41 included service charge and meetup fee. Any sides or extra drinks are not included.

I'll send you an email with the payment direction which I expect as soon as you RSVP, latest 7th February.

NOTE: If you cannot attend for any reason you are responsible to sell your place.

If you've paid and still see \"unpaid\" by your name, please don't take any notice.

Jacy:[masked]

Not quite as high as Robin's hill a week earlier ;) but traversing Gomshall-Ewhurst-Gomshall this walk will make the most of 257 m high Pitch Hill, crossing the Greensand ridge twice both N-S and S-N. Surrounding Ewhurst are a windmill used by smugglers to hide contraband and 'remains' of a Roman villa. Its church has a fine 13th-C font, and a memorial to a hapless victim of one of the less well known foreign policy misadventures of the early 20th-C. Gomshall at the end offers a choice of pubs for a sociable and hospitable wait for the train home :)

Outward Travel: Take the train departing 11 AM from London Waterloo to Gomshall via change at Guildford. Beforehand from 10.30 AM the organiser will be easy to spot in front of the ticket office in the centre of the station, wearing a bright yellow shirt or coat to act as a focal point for folks to arrange Groupsave tickets.

Buy a SUPER OFF-PEAK day return to GOMSHALL which is £12.60 with a GroupSave or Network card.

Walk start: 12 noon at Gomshall rail station. Circular walk.
Bring a packed lunch. Pub stops for drinks at Ewhurst and Gomshall. The return train to London leaves Gomshall at 17.51

*How to join?*
- The walk is entirely free of charge;
- You only arrange for your own travel and pub expenses;
- Understand our terms and conditions below (the \"IMPORTANT\" part);
- Understand how to stay safe outdoors, as you will be responsible for yourself. See our quick safety tips:
http://www.meetup.com/Free-Outdoor-Trips-From-London/about/
- Please answer the RSVP question; Guests with missing or incorrect answers will be removed from the list!

*What to bring*
- Plenty of water, 1-2 litres recommended
- Enough snacks and packed lunch to keep you energized along the walk
- Extra snacks and an extra packed lunch just in case
- Rainproof (ideally waterproof) clothing, sturdy shoes/boots you don't mind getting muddy
- Spare socks
- Spare T-shirt
- Towel
- Sun protection
- Walking poles and/or an umbrella :-)
- Yourself...
- ...and your camera!
- Cash for train ticket
- Cash for pub at the end of the walk?

Feel free to ask any questions in the comments section!

IMPORTANT
Please bear in mind this is a free of charge, self-guided trip with a hobby group. It is not organized by a business nor any entity with commercial purposes.
Any trip details, travel advice, route planning, instructions and other content in our group merely represent our shared personal knowledge, research and suggestions as outdoor enthusiasts. As this is no business, there is no \"product\", \"service\" or \"package\" and also no \"tour guide\", \"operator\" or \"walk leader\".
Each participant is responsible for their own safety. Even if some of us are very experienced walking outdoors, nobody assumes responsibility for any kind of injury, damage or loss that may happen.
Despite this, we take extreme precautions and all trips we plan are very safe, fun, highly educational and popular. Our experienced members volunteer their time and effort to shape a pleasant and quality adventure for everyone :-)
By participating you acknowledge and agree with this disclaimer.

Here are our tips on staying safe during outdoor trips:
http://www.meetup.com/Free-Outdoor-Trips-From-London/about/

TRAVEL, ACCOMMODATION, INSURANCE
Although we provide detailed suggestions, each participant is expected to arrange their own travel and (if required) accommodation - this gives everyone the freedom and choice to join from wherever they want and stay wherever they want. Anyone interested in travel or outdoor insurance should also arrange this on their own. As mentioned above we always take extreme precautions, but some people may still feel safer if covered.
As most of our trips are confirmed or postponed very close to the event date - heavily depending on the weather forecasts - we advise not to buy this until the last minute. People getting tickets from the same station are encouraged to meet early on the day to benefit from discounts such as GroupSave.

Any questions, feel free to ask below or send a private message!

EVENT DESCRIPTION
Are you an expat? Are you looking to find a new community of friends?
Join our Thursday afternoon mini-social for a light lunch or afternoon tea with cake and have a jolly good time with like-minded people!

*NOTE: This is our very first afternoon mini-social so we're still experimenting. Therefore we have an attendee limit. Each guest needs to RSVP to attend. Your feedback and ideas would be highly appreciated!*

*Who?*
Everybody! Anybody! At World Citizens you can find a mixture of international people, living in - or around - London. Here you can speak whatever language you want or be as quiet as a mouse\u2026 there is no script to follow!

*What do I do if I\u2019ve never attended before?*
Simple\u2026 come along and ask for World Citizens! We usually have allocated an area or table for ourselves. The rest is up to you but we will help you feel at ease! :-)

When/Where?
On this particular date, we start at 1:15pm and end at 3:15pm. We will meet at the Cafe at Foyles bookstore close to Soho (Leicester Square, Tottenham Court Road, Charing Cross).

Is that it?
Well yeah, pretty much! This meetup is what you make of it\u2026 if you want to meet new people and make new friends, the onus is on you to be engaging. If you\u2019re just curious, well that\u2019s fine too. 😊

Want to Help?
If you want to be part of the organizational team, we are always looking for committed people to keep the whole thing afloat. We do the best we can, considering we also have full time jobs and organize all this for free and on a voluntary basis.

DISCLAIMER
Despite all care and good intentions, it can happen that event details change. We rely on all members and guests of our community to take initiative and contribute to the positive spirit of each event, and not to always depend on the organizers.
We set up and promote these meetup events on an informal basis. We are not responsible for any damage or inconvenience caused or suffered during the events. We may take photos and videos of you at the events to help promote the event. By attending you agree with all terms of this disclaimer.

Treat yourself with a magnificent day to explore the deep woods, rolling parkland and picturesque fields of Kent. This diverse and absolutely stunning hike takes us on a journey via Knole House, Knole Deer Park and Ightham Mote. Don\u2019t miss out the opportunity to see the elegant deer.

Come and see for yourself why the beauty of this area attracted the Beatles to film promotional videos for \"Penny Lane\" and \"Strawberry Fields Forever\" here.

Trip Highlights:

\u2022 Hike along a stunning stretch of the Greensands Way - much of which is an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty

\u2022 Explore the magnificent 1000 acre Knole Deer Park

\u2022 See the stunning Knole House - one of England's largest houses boasting 365 rooms, 52 staircases, 12 entrances and 7 courtyards

\u2022 Pass through Ightham Mote - Grade I listed medieval moated manor house dating from circa 1340AD

Photos - All photos were taken by Outdooraholics on previous trips

Hike Description

Our hike takes us through the 1000 acre Knole Deer Park which is home to over 350 strong deer herd and whose picturesque landscape attracted the Beatles to film promotional videos for \"Penny Lane\" and \"Strawberry Fields Forever\". The videos went on to be selected by New York's MoMA as two of the most influential music videos of the late 1960s.

Knole House is one of England's largest houses boasting 365 rooms and 52 staircases and has remained surprisingly unchanged during its history going back to 1486. Being surrounded by the glorious 1000 acre Knole Deer Park completes its picturesque setting.

We also pass Ightham Mote, a largely original moated medieval manor house dating back to 1320 and described by David Starkey as \"one of the most beautiful and interesting of English country houses\". It also has an extensive history encompassing ownership from medieval knights to courtiers to Henry VIII.

Transport & Meeting Point

We'll meet at Charing Cross station at 9:00am and leave the meeting point at 9:15am for the 9:25am train. Please make sure to arrive on time as the group cannot wait for anyone who is late.

We'll meet in front of the ticket office and wait here. Please click here for a map of our meeting point: http://goo.gl/ApGVbL

Planned arrival time back into London of 5:35pm (we have a group train ticket and you are committed for the day until then)

Food

We'll stop during the hike for a snack lunch so please bring food and drink. We\u2019ll visit a pub after the hike where we can get refreshments.

Distance, Difficulty and Terrain

Distance: 11 miles (18km)
Grading: Intermediate - fairly gentle and mainly flat with a couple of hills
https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/11840782/Hike_Gradings
Hiking time: About 4 to 4.5 hours of actual hiking

Cost and Payment

The trip is £28 per person which includes the guided hike and return train travel from the group departure station listed at the top of this event. To join us please RSVP Yes and you will be automatically redirected to PayPal.

Payments are non-refundable and non-transferable but we have a process to release your space for resale to another member. Please follow the instructions in our FAQ page (https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/6368852/FAQ/) and email us with your PayPal \u201cinvoice ID\u201d immediately after you change your RSVP to \u201cNO\u201d. If you do not email us at the time of changing your RSVP OR if your space does not sell, you will not be eligible for a refund.

What to Bring

\u2022 Suitable hiking clothes & hiking footwear (ideally hiking boots). Waterproof jacket, trousers and footwear are recommended

\u2022 Water (at least 1 and ideally 2 litres)

\u2022 Packed lunch/picnic

\u2022 Money for drinks and refreshments after the hike

\u2022 That's it! We will take care of train tickets, logistics on the day, so that you can just turn up and have a great day :-)

Safety

This hike is led by a trained hike leader - most of our guides are Mountain Leader trained (http://www.mountain-training.org/walking/skills-and-awards/mountain-leader) and qualified Outdoor Activity First Aider. Outdoor activities involve a risk of personal injury. Please come with hiking footwear and suitable hiking clothes such as warm clothes, waterproof jacket and trousers in case of rain - for more info please click here: https://londonhiking.co.uk/Equipment.pdf

Come along on Saturday 8th February for a visit to Two Temple Place to see an exhibition called 'Unbound: Visionary Women Collecting Textiles'.

About the exhibition
Textiles and costume give us a beautiful and intensely human insight into our history. Unbound: Visionary Women Collecting Textiles celebrates seven pioneering women who saw beyond the purely functional, to reveal the extraordinary artistic, social and cultural importance of textiles. From the exquisite anthropological collections of traditional Balkan costume by Edith Durham, to the ground-breaking contemporary South Asian collection of Nima Poovaya-Smith, these women defied the \u2018traditional\u2019 concept of collecting \u2013 an activity still more often associated with men \u2013 and forged the way for textiles as crucial documents of social history as well as works of art in their own right.

This major collaborative project explores the innovative approaches of Edith Durham (1863 \u20131944), Louisa Pesel (1870 \u2013 1947), Olive Matthews (1887 \u2013 1979), Enid Marx (1902 \u2013 1998), Muriel Rose (1897 \u2013 1986), Jennifer Harris (working[masked]) and Nima Poovaya-Smith (Senior Keeper International Arts[masked], Cartwright Hall Art Gallery, Bradford), and presents the objects from a previously unexplored perspective: that of the female collector, rather than exclusively as the maker.

The visit is self-guiding.

We are meeting and entering the exhibtion at two different timeslots - 1:30pm and 2:30pm. Please indicate which time you wish to attend when you RSVP.

Entry to the exhibition is free. The group charges £2 per person for non-Full Members.
Go here to become a Full Member - http://www.meetup.com/London_Cultureseekers/dues/

Afterwards we will head to the 'George pub', 213 Strand, a short walk from the exhibition at 4pm for a chat over a drink.

If you can make it, please come to the pub afterwards, as its a great way to meet and get to know others after the visit.

Please note, we only wait outside the station for 10 minutes after the advertised meeting time, so please be early or on time.

If you can't see us outside the station, please text.

Look out for the red & blue 'London Cultureseekers' group sign.

Hope to see you there!

Robert
[masked] (prefer text)

Come along on Saturday 29th February to visit a new exhibition at the Queens Art Gallery on 'George IV: Art & Spectacle'.

About the exhibition
George IV (1762 - 1830) is arguably the most magnificent British monarch ever recorded and he formed an unrivalled collection of art, much of which remains in the Royal Collection.

Bringing together Dutch and Flemish masterpieces, portraits by Sir Thomas Lawrence and Sir Joshua Reynolds, delicate French porcelain, intricate goldsmiths\u2019 work and elegant books and drawings, this exhibition will present George\u2019s life through the art that enriched his world.

All the works of art on display come from the Royal Family's private collection.

The visit should last about 2 hours. The visit is self guiding using the audio guides provided.

Entry cost is £13.50 per person, book your own ticket at the link below and aim for the 2pm time slot - https://tickets.rct.uk/queens-gallery-buckingham-palace/george-iv-art-spectacle/2019

If you came to the 'Leonardo Da Vinci exhibition' at the Queens Gallery on 4th August last year, dig out your ticket as it gets you free entry to this exhibition. But you will need to contact the gallery beforehand to book your place in the 2pm timeslot -[masked], then pickup your ticket on the day.

Afterwards we will head to the 'The Feathers pub', 18-20 Broadway, a short walk from the gallery and near to St James's Park Tube Station at 4:00pm for a chat over a drink.

If you can, please come to the pub afterwards, as its a great way to meet others after the visit and its where friendships are formed!

Please note, we only wait outside the station for 10 minutes after the advertised meeting time, so please be early or on time.

If you can't see us outside the station, please text.

Look out for the red & blue 'London Cultureseekers' group sign.

Hope to see you there!

Robert
[masked] (text only)

Please make sure you are aware of the group rules here before RSVPing - https://www.meetup.com/London_Cultureseekers/pages/26449165/Group_Rules/

Come hiking on a glorious outing to Kent's picturesque Medway valley only one hour from London! Kent is one of the warmest parts of Britain. Twenty-eight per cent of the county forms part of two Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty. The river Medway meanders in between the North Downs and The High Weald. Encounter a secret trekking paradise where druids once held revered the yew trees in this area and hufflers men who hauled barges before horses took over, would work for the equivalent of £1 per day!

Yalding was one of the main shipping ports on the River Medway for transporting cannon from the iron industry and fruit from the many orchards in the area.

Edith Nesbit, author of The Railway Children, wrote in the 1920s: \"The Medway is a river of dreams...If you go to Yalding you may stay at the George and be comfortable in a little village that owns a haunted churchyard, a fine church, and one of the most beautiful bridges in Europe\u201d.

We will enjoy:

A relaxing riverside walk. Watch out for blue flash of the kingfisher.
A 15th century medieval bridge. Seven arches reputed to be the longest extant bridge in the county. 150m in length.
Kentish orchards. Known as the \"Garden of England\" for its abundance of hops and fruits.
Distinctive hop-drying buildings called oasts are common place, many have been converted into homes.
Gorgeous 15th century stained glass windows of Nettlestead Saxon church.
Pizien Well in Wateringbury. Pizien may be an olde English 'Poison'. Local superstition says a bride drinking the water from the well would be guaranteed fertility.
Wateringbury train station - a Grade II listed (in 1985) Tudor style station.
Last but not least. Teapot island! Guinness book-of-records entry largest collection tea pots!

HIKING INFO

Distance: 20km (12 miles) approx
Ascent: 290 metres
Estimated Duration (approx): 5 hours for walking
Difficulty: Moderate

https://drive.google.com/open?id=14u2E9DF9Q_wD394NafM9o736kfDINpST

TRAVEL LOGISTICS

Meetup Point: London Charing Cross by Nero Coffee
Meetup Time: 0845
Depart Meetup Point for the train: 0905
Train Departs: 0915
Train Arrives Yalding: 1028
Return Train Arrives London: 1731

The times stated are subject to change. It is impossible to promise a specific return time. Therefore, please consider yourself committed for the entire day.

PRICE INCLUDES

Guided Hike by a trained Summer Mountain Leader with Wilderness First Aid Training
PayPal fee
Return rail fare to and from stated destination

PRICE DOES NOT INCLUDE

Lunch, Souvenirs, Entrance fees to any attractions you wish to visit

WHAT TO WEAR BRING DAYSACK

Good boots for winter hiking shoes for summer
Waterproof jacket and trousers (Please no jeans!)
Water [2L recommended]
Hat/Gloves
Warm/Windproof layer
Wicking base layer e.g Merino/Polyester
Gaiters - possibly muddy fields
Camera & phone
Cash for the pub at the end
Packed lunch/snacks

HIKE ONLY, NO TRAIN TICKET REQUIRED

If you live locally or don't wish to meet in London you are welcome to make your own way. Simply change the PayPal amount to £10.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1GgmLQZ0yt2f3gYPxnOfH09M13NaFKFOi

RSVP / CANCELLING

If your plans change please update your RSVP \u2018no\u2019. Others can take advantage of the available place. If the hike sells out then please message us we will be happy to refund you.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=10woLFIQ4e7VqBcBDHgYfwrsvJrS-DTFl

SAFETY

We have operated over 800 events in the last ten years that have been free of major incidents. We have achieved this via meticulous planning. All participants (members and their guests) on any AAA London Group walk or activity are personally responsible for their own fitness, safety and welfare and must be equipped accordingly. If you have signed up to the event you acknowledge and accept the AAA London Group Terms and Conditions.

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1UgmiRtKVn8NFrVIx0TcdW3v_c6vBCbHC

This is a Firebase and Web technology Bootcamp, focusing on React.

During the course we will build a small To-Do list in React, using Firebase to have a password protected area, a real time database and deploy our app.

The course will last 4 weeks, every Monday from 27th of January till 17th of February.

Teachers & Mentors: Amanda Cavallaro, Duncan Ogle and Stefano Le Pera (Front End Developers at Gamesys).

---

It is free to attend. Please bring your own laptop.

---

Pizzas, snacks, sodas, juices and water will be provided.

---

18:30 - 19:30 First part of the lecture
19:40 - 20:15 Second part of the lecture
20:15 - 21:00 Hands-on and questions
21:30 - 22:00 Party!

Friday evenings at the British Museum are an occasion for a wide range of events, including lectures, discussions, film screenings, special music and dance performances, many of which are related to current exhibitions.

The British Museum's collection spans two million years, and includes cultural and historical exhibits from around the world.

-------------------------

Schedule

7.00 :

Group meets to attend British Museum's monthly Late.

9-12 :

The group progress to a nearby bar.

Being in London's Russel Square, local bars benefit from the energy, intrigue and dynamism that comes with the Central location; - with a scholarly feel, - thrown in for effect!

Get to know London's Bohemians, culture seekers, & artisans as we discuss the art and culture on display at the museum.

------------

Meeting

7.00 :

We meet just inside the large white \"dome room,\" (See photos section) which is easy to spot when you enter the Museum, (from Great Russell Street.)

If entering from the front entrance, at Great Russell Street,
go through baggage check & pass through an entrance hall.

You will arrive in a very large, white dome shaped room.

The meeting point is just to your right, in front of the stairs.

We meet by the information board.

/// (If you enter through the back entrance @ \"Montague Place,\" make your way towards the centre of the Museum. Go to the big white dome room, & go round in a circle until you find a large staircase on the other side.) ///

SEE PHOTOS SECTION BELOW.

--------------------

Keep an eye on the photos section below which will be updated on the day of the event with pictures of the meeting location.

Also keep an eye on comments. My number will be displayed on the evening of events.

7.15 :

If you are a few minutes late, don't worry, the group will remain at the meeting point, being introduced to one another, while we wait for everyone to arrive.

Here we introduce, make acquaintances, and choose which events to head off to.

----

Extra Info :

I will post our new location every time we move to a new area in the Museum so keep an eye on the comments section through the evening!

My number will be displayed in the comments section below, which you can call on message on the evening of events.

Let's get together on Saturday from 8:00PM at Roadhouse for drinks, socialising and live rock music. This is a fantastic environment for everyone to come along, meet new people and make some friends and have great fun.

If it is your first time coming to these sort of events, don't worry. There is no such thing as being a pro in meeting new people and starting a conversation. You will be greeted by one of the hosts when you arrive and introduced to other members.

Try to RSVP as soon as you know you are joining us this week as we have a limited space.

See you all very soon

** Important things to know before attending this Meetup

\u2022 You MUST carry a government issued photo ID, regardless of your age
\u2022 NO guaranteed admission. Venue reserves the right to refuse entry
\u2022 The venue may charge an entry fee
\u2022 You are advised to arrive as early as possible for socialising
\u2022 Dress code is smart casual

This event is completely FREE to attend for all the members and their guests. If you wish to show your support, you could offer to buy a drink for the event organisers :)

Welcome to the LWG Casual D&D Campaign!

From first timers to veterans, drop in to any sessions you want. We'll sort you into groups in the text below approx 24 hours before the session starts, and get you started on a one-shot adventure that fits into our campaign setting.

What is it?
Casual drop-in games set in the same world with an over-arching story. Play as much and whenever you like! Never played? No problem! Arrive early and we'll help you build a character, or we have a few set ones you can borrow.

What Do I Bring?
Pencil & paper, character sheet, dice, Player's Handbook & any other source books your character uses.

NEW PLAYERS:
You can make a level 2 character (PHB+1) and jump right in. Let your DM know you're new. If you need help with creating a character, message us before the night.

Due to limited spaces, players are limited to one session a week (not including any Saturday sessions).

MORE INFO: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YHxKchtWCuVPgLp8it2_rUHemUhhrKQD/view?usp=sharing

Arrival: 6:30 - 7pm.
Adventure!: 7-10pm
After session social: 10-11pm.
Please do be a few minutes early, as we MUST start at 7pm sharp!

DMs: Karim, Jake, Ollie

ADVENTURERS:

DM: Karim

DM: Jake O

DM: Ollie

Ben Nevis winter ascent and winter skills three day weekend
Deposit £150
Our very popular Winter Skills Weekend is the perfect quick hit to give you all the skills and confidence you require to travel in the winter mountains. we aim to provide you with experience of using all of the skills required for Ice Axe and Crampon use, Winter Navigation and Avalanche Awareness and Avoidance. We will combine the training of these skills with some great days out on the hill. This weekend will suit anyone looking to take their hillwalking to the next level.

Thursday: fly London to Glasgow, private transfer to our hostel, kit check and pre-trip brief, weather forecast, avalanche forecast, trip planning.

Friday: we will cover basic winter skills using ice axe and crampons.

Saturday: if the group is capable and the weather allows, we will tackle a winter ascent of Ben Nevis we may be able to traverse the mountain via the classic Carn Mor Dearg Arete.

Sunday: Glasgow flying back to London.

Instructor ratio: 1:6 for Ben Nevis ascent, 1:8 Friday and Sunday. Supervised by a qualified WML.

Kit List: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DPnO5292fK3AMwgznygii5EJia6JaYEvuQPhZPHFNmc/edit?usp=sharing

The Kit list is compulsory, not optional.

Open to experienced hikers who are used to long days out in the hills and are well equipped this trip is graded HARD, if you have any doubt or any questions about kit please contact me[masked]

Cost: £150 deposit payable on RSVP £175 balance, Total £325 Balance payable by 15th January to GO Venture LTD account No[masked] sort code[masked] Plese email me on [masked] and use the reference WSF20 to confirm receipt of payment

Your money is protected under the travel and package regulations.

Included: Return transport from Glasgow and throughout the weekend, three nights dormitory accommodation, guided hikes and instruction.

Not Included: evening meals, breakfast, lunches snacks, (there are shops and restaurants in Kinlochleven) transport from London.

Train- https://ojp.nationalrail.co.uk/service/planjourney/search

Bus- https://www.nationalexpress.com/en/

Flights: (recommended)
Thu 27th Feb Gatwick to Glasgow Easyjet EZY885-14:45 Arrival 16:20
Sun 1st Mar 18:15 Glasgow to Gatwick Easyjet EZY886 16:45 Arrival 18:15

These are the suggested flights our minibus will be picking us up from the airport at 17:00 if you are arriving by bus or train a short taxi ride will bring you to the airport.
There are plenty of flights available with budget airlines from all London airports If you choose to travel to take a different flight you will have to arrive Glasgow no later than 16:20, and Leave Glasgow no earlier than 16:45

Recommended search engines Skyscanner, Easyjet

As with all outdoor events the itinerary is weather dependent. If the weather does not allow an ascent of Ben Nevis we will find an alternative hiking itinerary.

By signing up to this event you have confirmed that you agree to GO London terms and conditions and participation statement:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XSic4Aj9VJguTQuiWrTd6I1A-EmvmQCqCHggB0omlX8/edit?usp=sharing

Another of Barrie's music and social history tours of Soho
this time we go back to the 1950's

VINTAGE SOHO - The 1950s
============================
Jazz clubs, coffee bars and drinking dens

On our Soho 50's walk, I will tell you about the first jazz clubs and coffee bars, the drinking dens and a little about 'the ladies of night' as well as how the various immigrant populations who settled in the area, helped create a truly international mix of music, food and drink as well as creating an atmosphere where even the seedy side of life seemed to enhance the magic of the area.

There will be stories of famous artists, up and coming singers, songwriters and musicians, and the many other characters who frequented Soho back then and made it such a vibrant area

So prepare yourself for a meander through the Soho of today but be prepared to travel back over 60 years for a nostalgic trip through time.

The tour costs the usual £10 and for any questions or queries contact me (Barrie) on[masked] or by e.mail at [masked]

National Gallery Friday Lates offer creativity, inspiration, conversation in a social space where everyone is welcome.

Enjoy socialising and discussion inspired by National Gallery's exhibitions, as we head to their Friday Late event to explore ideas about art, culture and society with a talks programme and \"Drop & Draw,\" art activities.

Start your weekend in style by visiting world-class exhibitions and discovering the Collection.

-----------------
Features:

Music & bar Ondaatje Wing Main Hall

Drop-in Drawing and Life Drawing

Talks & film screenings

---------

Schedule

7.15 :

Group meets to visit displays.
(Grab a brochure when you enter. There are maps & guides for the event.)

[masked] :

As a group, we have a few drinks and socialise at a nearby bar, after for drinks.

Get to know London's Bohemians, culture seekers & artisans, & discuss the art on display.
------------

Meeting

7.15 :
At the Sainsbury Wing in the National Gallery. Look to the right when you enter and go up the stairs to level 2. Keep an eye on the photos section which will be posted up on the day of the event for pictures of the meeting spot.

Also keep an eye on comments. My number will be displayed on the evening of events.

7.30 :

If you are a few minutes late, don't worry, at 7.15, we introduce ourselves and catch up, so you can catch the group just inside the entrance until 7.30.

Here, we make acquaintances, and choose which rooms to head off to.

----

Extra Info :

Keep an eye on the comments throughout the evening. I will post our new location every time we change to a different wing of the gallery.

----

Join us for a winter wander along the River Wey; a beautiful river walk which takes us past some stunning historic sites including poet John Donne\u2019s summer house and Newark Priory.

Suitable to those new to hiking, or looking for a gentle walk.

We\u2019ll take the train to West Byfleet where we\u2019ll walk down to join the river as it wends towards Guilford. We'll make our way skirting past the famous RHS Garden Wisley shortly and the beautiful old Elizabethan house which was poet John Donne\u2019s Summer House.

We\u2019ll continue on to (the wonderfully named) Send where we can stop for a drink and to eat our lunch then we'll continue onwards along the river via some lovely locks and keepers cottages after which we\u2019ll catch sight of the beautiful ancient Newark Priory.

Finally we'll pass Dapdune Wharf National Trust owned Lock house now a museum dedicated to the river and the wharf, and make our way into Guildford where we can enjoy a drink by one of the riverside pubs.

MEETING TIME: under the Clock at Waterloo Station at 09.45\u2013 I will have a Meet Up Sign. We\u2019ll take the 10:24 train to West Byfleet, arriving there at 10.52

COST: £8 on RSVP

Train tickets are your own responsibility and can be bought on the day ingroups of 3 or more in order to get the discounted rate of £11.15 (based on a group saver return) full rate (full rate £16.90). Please ensure you arrive at the meeting time to take advantage of this.

GRADE: Beginner- Easy, flat walk on riverside paths, possibly muddy.
Distance 14 miles approx. (5-6 hrs walking approx) Please wear hiking boots.

WHAT TO BRING: packed lunch, water (minimum 1 litre), snacks, money for post-walk pub drinks and food later on, suitable clothing Click here for more info.https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FLjSAczjgbZ26OKE4Iy_zX2IFqkybdXCmK9AkVfqI1w/edit?usp=sharing

Terms and conditions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XSic4Aj9VJguTQuiWrTd6I1A-EmvmQCqCHggB0omlX8/edit?usp=sharing

To view our full calendar: https://www.meetup.com/GO-London/events/

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/GoLondonAdventure/

Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/GoLondonHiking/

Treat yourself with a magnificent day to explore the deep woods, rolling parkland and picturesque fields of Kent. This diverse and absolutely stunning hike takes us on a journey via Knole House, Knole Deer Park and Ightham Mote. Don\u2019t miss out the opportunity to see the elegant deer.

Come and see for yourself why the beauty of this area attracted the Beatles to film promotional videos for \"Penny Lane\" and \"Strawberry Fields Forever\" here.

Trip Highlights:

\u2022 Hike along a stunning stretch of the Greensands Way - much of which is an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty

\u2022 Explore the magnificent 1000 acre Knole Deer Park

\u2022 See the stunning Knole House - one of England's largest houses boasting 365 rooms, 52 staircases, 12 entrances and 7 courtyards

\u2022 Pass through Ightham Mote - Grade I listed medieval moated manor house dating from circa 1340AD

Photos - All photos were taken by Outdooraholics on previous trips

Hike Description

Our hike takes us through the 1000 acre Knole Deer Park which is home to over 350 strong deer herd and whose picturesque landscape attracted the Beatles to film promotional videos for \"Penny Lane\" and \"Strawberry Fields Forever\". The videos went on to be selected by New York's MoMA as two of the most influential music videos of the late 1960s.

Knole House is one of England's largest houses boasting 365 rooms and 52 staircases and has remained surprisingly unchanged during its history going back to 1486. Being surrounded by the glorious 1000 acre Knole Deer Park completes its picturesque setting.

We also pass Ightham Mote, a largely original moated medieval manor house dating back to 1320 and described by David Starkey as \"one of the most beautiful and interesting of English country houses\". It also has an extensive history encompassing ownership from medieval knights to courtiers to Henry VIII.

Transport & Meeting Point

We'll meet at Charing Cross station at 9:00am and leave the meeting point at 9:15am for the 9:25am train. Please make sure to arrive on time as the group cannot wait for anyone who is late.

We'll meet in front of the ticket office and wait here. Please click here for a map of our meeting point: http://goo.gl/ApGVbL

Planned arrival time back into London of 5:35pm (we have a group train ticket and you are committed for the day until then)

Food

We'll stop during the hike for a snack lunch so please bring food and drink. We\u2019ll visit a pub after the hike where we can get refreshments.

Distance, Difficulty and Terrain

Distance: 11 miles (18km)
Grading: Intermediate - fairly gentle and mainly flat with a couple of hills
https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/11840782/Hike_Gradings
Hiking time: About 4 to 4.5 hours of actual hiking

Cost and Payment

The trip is £28 per person which includes the guided hike and return train travel from the group departure station listed at the top of this event. To join us please RSVP Yes and you will be automatically redirected to PayPal.

Payments are non-refundable and non-transferable but we have a process to release your space for resale to another member. Please follow the instructions in our FAQ page (https://www.meetup.com/Outdooraholics/pages/6368852/FAQ/) and email us with your PayPal \u201cinvoice ID\u201d immediately after you change your RSVP to \u201cNO\u201d. If you do not email us at the time of changing your RSVP OR if your space does not sell, you will not be eligible for a refund.

What to Bring

\u2022 Suitable hiking clothes & hiking footwear (ideally hiking boots). Waterproof jacket, trousers and footwear are recommended

\u2022 Water (at least 1 and ideally 2 litres)

\u2022 Packed lunch/picnic

\u2022 Money for drinks and refreshments after the hike

\u2022 That's it! We will take care of train tickets, logistics on the day, so that you can just turn up and have a great day :-)

Safety

This hike is led by a trained hike leader - most of our guides are Mountain Leader trained (http://www.mountain-training.org/walking/skills-and-awards/mountain-leader) and qualified Outdoor Activity First Aider. Outdoor activities involve a risk of personal injury. Please come with hiking footwear and suitable hiking clothes such as warm clothes, waterproof jacket and trousers in case of rain - for more info please click here: https://londonhiking.co.uk/Equipment.pdf

EVENT DESCRIPTION
Are you an expat? Are you looking to find a new community of friends?
Come for a chat, a drink and a jolly good time with like-minded people!

Who?
Everybody! Anybody! At World Citizens you can find a mixture of international people, living in - or around - London.
Here you can speak whatever language you want, be as quiet as a mouse, drink anything from tap water to jet fuel\u2026 there is no script to follow!

What do I do if I\u2019ve never been before?
Simple\u2026 come along, ask at the bar or at the entrance for World Citizens! We usually have allocated a standing area, usually next to the entrance.
(Hint: this is not a workshop, thus sitting is not our forte)

When/Where?
We meet every Friday, starting around 7pm. The location may vary, so keep an eye on the event\u2019s details.

Is that it?
Well yeah, pretty much! This meetup is what you make of it\u2026 if you want to meet new people and make new friends, the onus is on you to be engaging. If you\u2019re just curious, well that\u2019s fine too. 😊

Want to Help?
If you want to be part of the organizational team, we are always looking for committed people to keep the whole thing afloat. We do the best we can, considering we also have full time jobs and organize all this for free and on a voluntary basis.

NOTE: If you are so lucky to look as young as Cinderella, please bring an I.D. and be a law-abiding citizen ;)

DISCLAIMER
Despite all care and good intentions, it can happen that event details change. We rely on all members and guests of our community to take initiative and contribute to the positive spirit of each event, and not to always depend on the organizers.
We set up and promote these meetup events on an informal basis. We are not responsible for any damage or inconvenience caused or suffered during the events. We may take photos and videos of you at the events to help promote the event. By attending you agree with all terms of this disclaimer.

- IMPERIAL ASSAULT -

Hey everyone! Star Wars Imperial Assault is skirmish game set in the star wars universe, played on a tile-based board, with incredibly intricate corners, missions, and Maps. Using the IACP format, the range of units which are now playable has increased exponentially, ensuring you the best gameplay possible! Whether you love commanding Darth Vader and his stormtroopers, Luke Skywalker and his friends, Jabba and his hunters, or a swarm of angry Wookies, Imperial Assault has content for everyone!

It's a wonderfully detailed game, one which any Star Wars or Skirmish game fan should try out! For that reason, I will be hosting this Learn to Play event at the LWG, where I will be bringing my collection to supply lists, maps, and dice for everyone interested, so there is no purchase or risk necessary! Just come, play some games, get some exclusive promos, and give it a try! Join the WhatsApp channel for details, links, future dates, and discussion! Hope to see you there!

- Isaac

NOTE: If you have any request units or characters you want to field, let me know on WhataApp. Unless Spots max out, this will be on a first come first served basis, as I would only have my own collection.

ANOTHER NOTE: Spaces are capped at 8 players per event, so register soon!

- THE LOCATION -

The location is near the popular Seven Dials area of Covent Garden. There's plenty of food up for grabs so feel free to grab something to bring. Beer and other bar refreshments available for very reasonable prices at the bar.

- THE LONDON WARGAMING GUILD -

This event is run by The London Wargaming Guild a not-for-profit, volunteer run group of passionate hobbyists.

Welcome to LoB. Some points to consider:

• If you're new, please check out our guide for new players.

• If you have questions or need help, either ask the Host (if there is one) or find one of our Helpers (check list of attendees for anyone marked 'Event organizer' or with a red star on the app) and just ask! Helpers are always happy to answer your questions or clarify how the event works. Even if there is no host or helper you should find us a helpful and friendly bunch so don't be afraid to ask questions.

• Please RSVP if you are planning to attend, and make sure it is up to date if your plans change. Be considerate of other members – we often have large waiting lists. Similarly, please don't turn up if your RSVP is not confirmed, as space is limited.

• Admittance is free – but please buy a drink and/or food at the venue if you can. Our use of the room is dependent on the venue making some money during the event.

• If you move tables to play on please make sure you return them to their original arrangement once you are finished.

• Check out our lovely forums where you can discuss all things LoB, including tournaments, lost & found, trading and special events...

• Please read our rules and regulations – attendance at LoB implies acceptance of them.

Hi all!

Welcome! Get ready to enjoy tasty pizza and beer, while learning about the latest and greatest in cloud native.

6:00 Reception open
6:30 Food and drink
7:00 Reception close + Kick off
7:15 The Cheesy Analogy of MLflow and Kubeflow (Byron Allen, Servian)
7:45 Cloud native disaster recovery in Cloud (Ines Cheikhrouhou, Agyla)
8:15 Break
8:30 My Journey into Site Reliability Engineering (Jai Campbell, Contino)
9:00 Wrap up and pub

See you there!

Cheryl (@oicheryl)

========================================================
The Cheesy Analogy of MLflow and Kubeflow (Byron Allen, Servian)
MLflow. Kubeflow. Both are open-source projects. Both are supported by major players in the data analytics industry. MLflow is backed by Databricks and Kubeflow is widely backed by Google. Both tools are touted as the next best thing since sliced bread when it comes to tracking ML experiments and supporting the production ML lifecycle. But how do they compare?

Byron is a Texan transplant to Australia turned Australian transplant to the UK. He works as a consultant at Servian in their London office, wearing a few hats - ML engineer, data engineer, cloud engineer, data scientist, and scrum master - and has a passion for all things related to the produciton ML lifecycle along with cheesy analogies.
--
Cloud native disaster recovery in Cloud (Ines Cheikhrouhou, Agyla)
A talk about challenges faced before and thru planning and executing disaster recovery in the cloud.

Ines is a Devops and cloud consultant, find her on twitter @icheikhrouhou
--
My Journey into Site Reliability Engineering (Jai Campbell, Contino)
Intro about myself and my growing participation and interest in the cloud native community, why I started the London SRE meetup group and how current and future CNCF projects sit well with working as an SRE.
My origin as a Wintel (Windows Engineer) and how my career changed dramatically as I pivoted into DevOps then onto SRE.
This forms a story where I describe how some of the tools and principles I learnt as a Wintel engineer were transferable and how they compare and contrast with the tools and principles of SRE today, notably the cloud native tools in the CNCF landscape and those that I use in GCP.
I will also provide advise to the audience for those who may have questions about what is required from an SRE and SRE team and what skills and training I have found valuable in working in the role for those wishing to make the transition to becoming an SRE.
As a relatively new SRE what tools in the CNCF I use/have used and those that I find invaluable to perform my role.
As a SRE and as the year takes shape, what am I excited about in the CNCF and the CDF landscapes.
Chaos engineering and SRE, how the two principles overlap and complement each other.

Jai Campbell is a Google Cloud Consultant / Site Reliability Engineer at Buildit @ Wipro, and Lead Organiser of the London SRE Site Reliability Engineering meetup group. Jai has been working as an SRE for the last two years mainly on AWS, GCP and Azure. Jai has 4 professional GCP certs ranging from security to developing apps, this year Jai plans to add more to that list with the CKA and CKAD being the certs he is currently working towards. His favourite sports team is the Golden State Warriors, with San Fran being his favourite holiday destination.
========================================================
Check out https://www.oicheryl.com/cloudnativelondon if you're interested in speaking or sponsoring.

Welcome to LoB. Some points to consider:

• If you're new, please check out our guide for new players.

• If you have questions or need help, either ask the Host (if there is one) or find one of our Helpers (check list of attendees for anyone marked 'Event organizer' or with a red star on the app) and just ask! Helpers are always happy to answer your questions or clarify how the event works. Even if there is no host or helper you should find us a helpful and friendly bunch so don't be afraid to ask questions.

• Please RSVP if you are planning to attend, and make sure it is up to date if your plans change. Be considerate of other members – we often have large waiting lists. Similarly, please don't turn up if your RSVP is not confirmed, as space is limited.

• Admittance is free – but please buy a drink and/or food at the venue if you can. Our use of the room is dependent on the venue making some money during the event.

• If you move tables to play on please make sure you return them to their original arrangement once you are finished.

• Check out our lovely forums where you can discuss all things LoB, including tournaments, lost & found, trading and special events...

• Please read our rules and regulations – attendance at LoB implies acceptance of them.

South Downs, Black Down, the Serpent trail and Temple of the winds

This walk within the northern edges of the south downs national park and in the Sussex Weald takes along the Serpent Trail through the beautiful heathland and woodlands of West Sussex.
From Haslemere, we pick up the Sussex border path Marley Common,
a mixed broadleaf and Chestnut woodland and open heath which is grazed by belted Galloway cattle. This is one of the National Trust's oldest countryside acquisitions.

Heading south to Marley Heights we walk to the village of Fernhurst where Bertrand Russell the British Philosopher wrote some of his works and weave our way to Reeth where a steep climb takes us the to the Temple of the Winds viewpoint, and stunning views towards the South Downs and on a clear day as far as the English Channel.
We continue up to the trig point on Black Down which at 280m South Downs National Park.

Black Down has strong literary associations with the poet Alfred Tennyson. who in 1869 purchased Black Down, and built Aldworth house a French-style Gothic house built of local sandstone to use as a summer residence. we descend past Aldworth House past to the pretty market town of Haslemere, where you can take the train back home or join us for a well-earned beer and some food.

MEETING TIME: 09:00 London Waterloo Railway station underneath the main clock. I will have a meetup sign. We will be taking the 09.30 train from London Waterloo arriving in Haslemere at 10.30 journey time 1 hr. Walk finishes approx 16:30

COST: organiser fee £8 on RSVP.

Train Fare is not included, buy on the day £15.30pp group saver, please bring the correct cash and arrive prompt to be included in group tickets.

GRADE: Beginner/Intermediate, on rough tracks with some steep hills. 19km 12miles 6hrs hiking 600m ascent.

What to bring: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FLjSAczjgbZ26OKE4Iy_zX2IFqkybdXCmK9AkVfqI1w/edit?usp=sharing

Terms and conditions: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XSic4Aj9VJguTQuiWrTd6I1A-EmvmQCqCHggB0omlX8/edit?usp=sharing

To view our full calendar: https://www.meetup.com/GO-London/events/

Contact: [masked] -[masked]

Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/GoLondonHiking/
